name: Toby-WA State
description: Meet our newest friends, Blake and Toby. Blake is the buff and white boy, and Toby is the black and white boy. Both boys are on the larger size for cockers (over 40 pounds) and are currently living in Washington State. Sadly, their original owner could no longer take care of them and handed them off to a relative who is already overwhelmed with her own personal 5 dogs and does not have her own house until after the first of the year. They are very sweet boys, but they have not been socialized with other dogs, so the situation is tough. The boys are spending a lot of time in crates just to keep the peace. This is not good for them and the kind hearted lady who is taking care of them knows that. She wants them to have a good life. They have common issues, cherry eye, dry eye, cocker ears and skin allergies. She is willing to help out with medical expenses but needs to get them out of her temporary home and into a foster or adoptive home. We think it would be ok to separate them as some of the behavior may tone down if they are separated (litter-mate syndrome). Both boys are 6 years old, neutered and housebroken. It would be best for them to go to a home with no other pets until they can be socialized properly. Blake is initially more shy than Toby, and Toby is more active. If you can foster or adopt one or both, we want to hear from you!

name: Bella 3075
description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sweet Bella was stray who was found by a Good Samaritan in Miami-Dade. She is estimated to be 2-3 years old & weighs 45 pounds. She knows basic commands, walks well on leash, playful energy, loves car rides, is affectionate, potty trained and is well mannered. She can get the zoomies & likes to play with toys. As many dogs do, she gets anxious when undergoing medical examinations & treatment. She reacted to other dogs in the kennel but has not been temperament tested. She is currently in a foster home. She has good house manners, and is crate trained.

name: dippin dots is a saint
description:
hi
I'm dipping dots and I am perfect. 
truly perfect. 
nicest, nicest, NICEST lady you will meet. 
I am around 7 years old and was discarded at a high intake shelter after being used my entire life for breeding. we know this because of my body but also because of my number tattoo on my inner ear. 
lucky for me-i was rescued and life is now extraordinary! 
I lounge in the sun, hang with dog friends, take. naps on cozy beds, and get love from humans all day long 
I could live anywhere with anyone and just about anything breathing as long as you provide love and cozy stuff. 
My hips are worn so I take pain meds to help-they do! 
joint supplements also help 
I weigh around 40 lbs 
I can't wait to be your best friend 

please note
All of our dogs are in private foster homes. Once you fill out an application it will be screened by our volunteer adoption team. From there, if your application 
looks like a good fit for the particular dog, it will be sent to the foster where you can ask all the questions you would like and schedule a meet and greet. We do not transport our dogs. If you apply from out of state we do request you come to Los Angeles to meet us and fly home in cabin or drive. 
www.apurposefulrescue.org

name: Crown
description:
Meet Crown!

Crown is a handsome 4-year-old Pit Bull with a heart as big as his smile! He was lovingly surrendered when his owner realized they didn't have the help they needed to care for him. Now, we're hoping to find Crown the perfect family who can give him all the love and attention he deserves!

Crown is housebroken, crate trained, and has excellent leash manners-he's a fantastic walking buddy! He gets along wonderfully with other dogs, does well with cats, and absolutely loves kids. His previous owner described him as quiet, sweet, playful, and super affectionate. Whether he's snuggling on the couch or going for car rides (one of his favorite things!), Crown is always happiest when he's with his people.

We know Crown would make an amazing family dog, and we'd love to see him find his forever home soon. If you're looking for a loyal, loving companion, Crown is ready to meet you!

name: Piper
breed: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Chihuahua Mix
description:
Meet Piper! She is about 2yrs. old. She does well with children and other dogs. Piper lives up to her breed traits- she's smart, loving, playful, and active! Her ideal family would be one that regularly hikes, walks, runs, and preferably has another dog as a playmate for her.

Piper is spayed, up-to-date on vaccines, and microchipped. She is currently living in a home setting with a foster family while she waits to find her forever home. You can find more info on our Facebook or IG pages. If you are interested in adopting Piper an adoption application can be found on our website muttsandrunts.org/application

name: Rusty
description:
Rusty is an incredibly sweet and loving 1-year-old Pointer/Terrier mix who was rescued from a terrible situation in Texas by Paws and Hooves Animal Rescue, Inc. We are partnering with them to help find this guy a home. Rusty will truly melt you heart. He just emanates love.Rusty is a gentle pup who adores people and getting hugs and pets and solicits them with happy tail wags and kisses. He also does well with other dogs and quite likes frolicking around with them at playtime. 

He has mild congenital issue with his knees (they are a little knobby) but he gets around great and it doesn't slow him down when he plays with his canine pals. At 42 lbs, he is just the perfect size and his disposition makes him an ideal family dog. Inquire about Rusty today!

name: Patty
description:
Please say hello to PATTY!  

PATTY is a female hound mix who was born February 2024.  Patty has been waiting awhile for her forever home and hopes that someone will soon decide that they want her to join their family. Adopt PATTY today!

This pet is spayed or neutered in accordance with our strict policy wherein all animals are altered prior to adoption. This pet is de-wormed, current on vaccines, and started on monthly flea/tick preventatives.

Animal Alliance does not adopt adult dogs (over 9 months old) into households with children under 9 years of age due to the risk of bites. Puppies 9 months of age or younger can be adopted into households with young children ages 4 and older. We do not adopt to families with children 3 years and younger or expectant families due to the safety risk for infants and toddlers.

Prior to submitting an application, please see the Animal Alliance Adoption Process for adoption details.

Animal Alliance is not a shelter where all the animals are housed in one location. Animal Alliance is a foster care network and animals are housed in many different locations. If you are interested in adopting a pet, please apply using the online application; applicants who call our phone line will hear a recorded voicemail with this identical message. We adopt many animals each week and meet prospective adopters at various locations so they can meet the animals they are interested in.

To fill out an adoption application, go to:
https://www.animalalliancenj.org/fosteradoption-application/

name: LAYLA DAKOTA
description:
Meet Layla Dakota A Survivor Ready for Love

Layla Dakota may have had a rough start, but shes not letting her past define her future. At just one year old, this resilient girl has already endured abuse, neglect, and being heartlessly dumped. Shes never truly known the love of a family, and it shows in her social skillsshes still learning what it means to trust, to feel safe, and to simply be a dog.

While shes not a fan of other dogs or cats, Layla adores people and kids. She thrives on affection, soaking up every cuddle and moment of kindness she can get. Despite everything shes been through, her heart is wide open for the right persona patient, understanding soul who will show her that she is worthy of love.

Right now, Layla is being boarded, but thats no place for a dog who craves connection. She needs a foster or adopter willing to give her the time, stability, and compassion shes never had. With the right person, her potential is endless.

Could that be you? Layla is waiting for someone to show her that shes finally home. If youre ready to change her world, shell return the favor with a lifetime of loyalty and love.

name: Woody
description: Woody had a rough past as he was found with his siblings on the side of the road in a cold winter when he was 5 weeks old. Like any puppy he loves to play and have fun but also can settle down and cuddle as well. Woody plays well with other dogs and does not pay much attention to the cats. He has been wonderful with all adults and fine when playing with a 15 year old and two eight year old. Woody does well in his crate -- it is his safe place. He is working on his house training. Woody will make a wonderful addition to any household.Please submit an application at http://helpinghoundsdogrescue.org A processed application is required to visit the rescue.

name: Chamberlain
description:
Meet Chamberlain!

Chamberlain is a stunning 2-year-old Blue Pit Bull. Neutered and heartworm negative, this healthy boy is ready to find his forever home.

Despite his strong physique, he's a gentle giant who wants nothing more than to cuddle and spend quality time with his humans.

Chamberlain is a smart and obedient pup who knows basic commands and has been kennel trained previously. His familiarity with routines makes him a wonderful companion for those who appreciate a well-mannered dog.

He might do well with a compatible female dog after proper introductions, but he'd also be perfectly happy as the only dog in the home. He does not get along with cats, so a feline-free environment is a must.

Chamberlain is your boy! His strength is matched only by his big heart, and he's eager to share it with a family who will give him the love and confidence he deserves.

name: Celeste
description:
Am I a pittie or a potato? I'm both! I'm a friendly, affectionate girl who loves a squeaker toy. I can give a toothy grin when I'm nervous--I call it my anxious pit face. I dream of snuggling on your couch. I like to get butt scritches (my piggie noises prove it), but leave my tail alone please (it's sensitive). I'll benefit from time to warm up to new people, a solid routine, a cozy retreat, opportunities to explore, and playtime. Take me home today!

Kids: Any age kids, worried by novel objects and fast movements, may steal kids' stuffies

Dogs: Stiff, high tail, extremely quick to correct, controlling. Can be very reactive on leash. Slow intros with passive and tolerant, gentle dogs. NO CATS OR SMALL DOGS. May prefer to be the only animal in the home.

name: SNAPDRAGON
description:
Snapdragon can't wait for a forever home. He was born on 12/19/24 and is a handsome Hound mixed breed. This pup has a lot of fun puppy energy and he loves to run. Once he gets his energy out, he loves to settle in for a good cuddle session. He enjoys playing with his siblings and is going to make one family very happy. He is up to date on vaccinations and will be neutered when he is old enough (it's part of his adoption fee).

*PLEASE NOTE: DUE TO STRINGENT OUT OF STATE HEALTH CERTIFICATE REQUIREMENTS WE ARE NOW ONLY ADOPTING TO RHODE ISLAND RESIDENTS*. We apologize for the inconvenience.

HOW TO GO ABOUT ADOPTING: 
1. Come in during adoption hours to apply and full out an application completely. We have applications on site. Open adoption hours take place at 44 Worthington Road in Cranston, RI. We are open every Wednesday 3-7pm and Saturday 10am-2pm.
2. We require proof of homeownership (tax form, deed, mortgage statement) or landlord approval (a copy of your lease that clearly states you are allowed to have a dog, puppy, cat, or kitten OR written and signed consent from your landlord. 
3. We require copies of up to date vet records for any current pets. 

Helpful reminders:
*We do not do same day adoptions.
*Please bring the entire family in to meet the animal you are interested in. 
*We will setup a meet and greet with your dog at a later date. PLEASE do not bring your dog with you when you come in to apply.

name: Diesel **Courtesy Post. Out of town pet. See below for details**
description:
DIESEL IS AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION OR RESCUE!

DIESEL VIDEO:
_https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Tz_9fRNpGwduCaslLtdC7C9NTQs_BgUB/view?usp=drive_link
_ https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YOMAWsG5xiiqtvDkvpaDQ5fkcJ7jNGT0/view?usp=drive_link
_ https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iOt2M2JmGxb3i1ObXwPKBYs-tHEkOPQR/view?usp=drive_link

CONTACT: Espanola Humane
108 Hamm Parkway
Española, NM, 87532
sara@espanolahumane.org
DESKLINE: (505) 753-8662

PERSONALITY TRAITS
LOOK AT THAT FACE! How could anybody say “NO” to that face?? Diesel is a young boy that came to the shelter as a stray. He is good with other dogs and enjoys off leash doggy playgroups. He knows basic commands and is house/leash trained. He must've had a family/person that loved him at some point. Diesel has met male and female dogs of different sizes. He interacts but isn't overly playful. He's patient with young, overzealous dogs, but would likely prefer to be in a home with another dog(s) that has a more mellow vibe. He may be able to live with cats and other smaller animals, but would need to be monitored and trained in how to coexist.

What shelter staff & volunteers had to say about Diesel:
Diesel is a handsome blockhead of a boy, with a bobbed tail that likes to wiggle when he's feeling good. Excellent on leash, he's a gentleman on walks, with an easygoing demeanor. Diesel likes to hang out with other dogs, even if he doesn't play, and could sit or lie by your side for hours so long as you're paying attention to him. A pretty mellow dude, Diesel would likely be just as happy on a camping or
hiking trip as he would couch surfing and watching a movie with his person.

Please contact Espanola Humane for more information and to arrange a meet n' greet. If you already have a dog, please bring them with you for a proper introduction.

BREED: Bully breed blend
AGE: 2-1/2 years

HEALTH: All rescue dogs are vaccinated, altered, and micro-chipped.

GOOD WITH: Dogs; respectful children, possibly cats & other small animals – would need further testing

name: Tootsie Roll
description:
One-year-old Tootsie Roll is looking for a foster home! Just look at that sweet smile . This 50-pound boy was found tied to a gate during the winter storm, and his paws were injured from the cold. Thankfully, that is behind him now; he feels better and is ready for a loving family. 

We are still gathering information about his friendliness with dogs, cats, and kids. Therefore, we would like him to go to a temporary foster home so we can observe his behavior outside of the shelter environment. Understanding this information will help him get adopted more quickly. Please come to the shelter to visit him!

name: DOT
description:
DOT IS IN HER
FOSTER HOME IN MEMPHIS, TN, AND WILL BE TRANSPORTED TO MD ONCE ADOPTED!

Dot
10 year old Papillion mix
Weighs approx. 12lbs and is on a weight loss journey to keep her joints healthy
 Up to date on all necessary vetting and just had a full dental procedure done
Good with other dogs (small and large)
Tolerates cats who respect her space
Good with kids

Little Ms. Dot is sweet as pie and is looking for a home to snuggle up and settle down. She may be 10 years old, but she doesn't act a day over 5! She loves to dance, run, jump, and play. She's completely potty trained, walks well on a leash when needed, and is a quiet and calm house mate. If you're looking for a low maintenance buddy to hang out with - Dot is your girl.

Vetting

includes spay/neuter, microchip, rabies and all vaccinations. Her adoption fee of $600 includes the transport to MD. We use a licensed and registered USDA transport company that will bring Dot up north to her new family.

If you have any questions, please email us at: newbeginnings_animalrescue@yahoo.com

You can apply to adopt Dot here: www.newbeginningsanimalrescue.net

THANK YOU FOR CONSIDERING ADOPTING A RESCUED PET!

name: Scooby Husk
description:
Meet Scooby, a handsome 3-year-old Alaskan Malamute and Husky mix weighing 52 lbs. Scooby loves his toys and enjoys the great outdoors, whether it's hiking or spending time at the beach. He gets along wonderfully with other dogs, making him a fantastic companion for an active family. If you're looking for an adventurous and playful friend, Scooby is the perfect match!

To complete an adoption application please visit
https://anlcf.org/available-dogs/

Applicants are typically contacted within two to three days from submission. Adopters are chosen based on the best fit for the dog. If your application is approved, we will contact you to set up an appointment to speak further and meet in San Diego.

Website:
www.anlcf.org 

Donate: 
www.anlcf.org/donate/ 
By donating to our organization, you can directly support the rescue & care of dogs in need. Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference in the lives of these animals.

Instagram:
@anewliferescue

A New Life Charitable Foundation, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) accredited rescue committed to helping dogs regardless of size or breed! All pups available for adoption are microchipped, up to date on vaccines, up-to-date on dewormer, medically and behaviorally cleared and spayed/neutered.
Adoption fees are $495 for puppies, $395 for adult dogs, and $250 for senior dogs.


#RescueDogs #AdoptDontShop #ForeverHomeNeeded #PuppyLove

name: Declan
description:
Here is Declan!  Declan was rescued in a neighborhood after being very neglected. Here is what we have learned about Declan:

Labrador Retriever mix, male
Approximately five years old
Approximately 47 lbs.
Housetrained
Gets along with other dogs and all people

All dogs come with medical file that shows they are spay/neuter, have all shots, heartworm test, and current on heartworm/flea and tick prevention.

If interested, please submit an adoption application located on our website at hsgconline.org.

name: Jasmine
description:
Because we are all volunteers, Illinois Doberman Rescue Plus only considers approved applicants to meet our orphans in our foster homes. Please read our eligibility requirements and apply on our website: www.ildoberescue.com/adopt. After an application is submitted, additional inquiries can email dobes@ildoberescue.com.

This lovely lady is Jasmine and she came to us from Southern Illinois where she was surrendered to an area shelter. She is about 6.5 years old – very sweet and low key. She walks well on a leash and used to live with a Chihuahua so is likely good with small dogs. We are told she will chase cats. She loves treats and is very willing to learn! Don’t miss out on this beauty!
